DataElement.preferredName: Medical Imaging Positron Emission Tomography Not Complete Period Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the specified time period a scheduled positron emission tomography (PET) scan was not complete.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Imaging Positron Emission Tomography Not Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical imaging positron emission tomography (PET) scan not being complete.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not; used for negation of a word or group of words.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
